intro: Erigeron evermannii, commonly known as the Evermann's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron evermannii is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
